data.title: St Andrew's Stadium Parking - Pre-Book Parking near Birmingham City FC
data.meta_description: Park at St Andrew's Stadium from just £9.25/day. With 1000 spaces available, save money on your event parking today by pre-booking parking spaces on an hourly, daily, weekly or monthly basis.
data.text:
St Andrew’s Stadium, located in the Bordesley area of Birmingham, is the home ground of Birmingham City FC. The club were founded in 1875 and moved into St Andrew’s in 1906. Their nickname is the blues due to the colour of their home strip. They have played in the top division for most of their existence and have won the League Cup twice, much to the delight of Birmingham City fans. Their current manager is Garry Monk and he has been instrumental in the recent news that Birmingham City completed signing of free agent after a successful trial. This will no doubt be fantastic news to fans who have been anxious to see the team reach the heights of an FA cup final in the future.

There have been reports in the press recently that three senior staff members decided to leave Birmingham City, but the team are looking forward to the season ahead. In the coming months games will include Birmingham City VS Leeds United, West Brom and Aston Villa.

St Andrew’s stadium features a small car park but this can become full very quickly. There is some on street parking near the stadium but it is generally quicker and cheaper to book your parking space in advance to avoid disappointment. The nearest station to the ground is Bordesley, located roughly ten minutes away. It provides services to Birmingham Snow Hill and Birmingham Moor Street.

The majority of pubs in the proximity to St Andrew’s are for home fans only. It is therefore best to drink in the city centre where there are a great variety of places to eat, drink, shop, or visit. These include the Bull Ring Shopping Centre, which is full of shops, restaurants, and bars; the Mailbox, featuring a great number of restaurants; and Cadbury World is a great family attraction, if you have time to spend in the area.

Postcode for satnav: B9 4RL

Which team plays at St Andrews Stadium?

Birmingham City FC call St Andrews Stadium their home ground. The club moved to this stadium in 1906.

Does St Andrews Stadium have its own car park?

St Andrews Stadium does have its own small car park. However, this fills up very quickly on match days so it's recommended that supporters make alternative arrangements. On YourParkingSpace you can find a number of nearby pre-bookable parking spaces and car parks.

Is there on-street parking available around St Andrews Stadium?

There is limited on-street parking near the stadium, but this can be busy. On-street parking may be found off the left-hand side of the ring road.

What public transport options are there for getting to St Andrews Stadium?

The nearest train station is Bordesley, situated about ten minutes’ walk away. From here, there are services to Birmingham Snow Hill and Birmingham Moor Street.

What is the capacity of St Andrews Stadium?

The capacity of St Andrews Stadium is 29,409.

Where is the away end and how many away fans can St Andrews Stadium accommodate?

Away supporters are located on one side of the Gil Merrick Stand at one end of the stadium in the lower tier. The normal allocation for away fans is around 3000 tickets.

What is the address of St Andrews Stadium?

St Andrews Stadium is located at St Andrew’s Ground, Birmingham, B9 4RL.
